Nathan wrote:
> 
> A good mediatype like XHTML constrains the format of the message, the 
> representation of it, without constraining the actual message which
> is encoded.
> 

Data type.  The XHTML family of data types may be served using any of
text/plain, application/xhtml+xml or text/html (except for XHTML 1.1 and
basic) as the media type.

-Eric
